azurerm_logic_app_trigger_http_request.description: Manages a HTTP Request Trigger within a Logic App Workflow

name.description: Specifies the name of the HTTP Request Trigger to be created within the Logic App Workflow. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
name.notes: This name must be unique across all Triggers within the Logic App Workflow.

logic_app_id.description: Specifies the ID of the Logic App Workflow. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

schema.description: A JSON Blob defining the Schema of the incoming request. This needs to be valid JSON.
schema.notes: To make the Trigger more readable, you may wish to consider using HEREDOC syntax (as shown above) or [the `local_file` resource](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/local/d/file.html) to load the schema from a file on disk.

method.description: Specifies the HTTP Method which the request be using. Possible values include `DELETE`, `GET`, `PATCH`, `POST` or `PUT`.

relative_path.description: Specifies the Relative Path used for this Request.
relative_path.notes: When `relative_path` is set a `method` must also be set.

id.description: The ID of the HTTP Request Trigger within the Logic App Workflow.

create.description: Used when creating the Logic App HTTP Request Trigger.

update.description: Used when updating the Logic App HTTP Request Trigger.

read.description: Used when retrieving the Logic App HTTP Request Trigger.

delete.description: Used when deleting the Logic App HTTP Request Trigger.
